name: PET_Preproc_GLM
description: This function segments and normalizes the T1 and the PET images. The user can also smooth the result. Then this function also makes a statistical analysis of a PET file of a patient versus a list of controls based on the GLM (Generalized linear model)
command-line: eval export MCR_CACHE_ROOT=/tmp; unzip [STRING_CONTROLS_PET]; mkdir [OUT_FOLDER]; run_processing_fdg_T1.sh /usr/local/MATLAB/R2017b/mcr [STRING_3DT1] [STRING_PET] [OUT_FOLDER] [STRING_REF] [STRING_SMOOTH] [SIZE_SMOOTH]; tar -czcf [OUT_FOLDER]_preproc.tar.gz [OUT_FOLDER] ; mkdir [OUT_FOLDER]_glm ; run_GLM_PET_v2.sh /usr/local/MATLAB/R2017b/mcr control [OUT_FOLDER]/sw[STRING_PET] [MASK_FILE] [OUT_FOLDER]_glm [THRESH_TYPE] [THRESH_VALUE]; tar -czcf [OUT_FOLDER]_glm.tar.gz [OUT_FOLDER]_glm
author: Carole Lartizien

inputs.name: Output folder name
inputs.description: Choose a name for your output folder

inputs.name: Reference image file
inputs.description: Select the reference image for the normalization

inputs.name: smoothing option
inputs.description: Option for smoothing. Select true for smoothing.

inputs.name: FWHM of the gaussian kernel
inputs.description: Specify  the  full-width  at half maximum (FWHM) of the Gaussian smoothing kernel in mm.

inputs.name: control folder PET
inputs.description: Select the folder containing the list of the PET controls which are already processed and smoothed

inputs.name: Threshold type
inputs.description: Choose the type of threshold you want apply to your study. The two choices are : none or FWE

inputs.name: Threshold value
inputs.description: Choose the value corresponding to the threshold type. Basically for the threshold none the value is 0.001 and for FWE it is 0.05
